title.narrative: Entrepreneurs Capacity building – A value adding Business+ Institutional support

description.narrative:
Easy communication of business women with EAC partners AFAB members are well trained on business English and can use it fluently Staff improve English progressively and empowered to work in English environment Staff improve the way to help entrepreneurs to communicate with the English speakers partners in their business. 17 AFAB members are well trained on business English and can use it fluently : understanding, speaking and writing 3 staff members have completed an English course
Development of ICT skills and other important practical business skills SMEs work in accordance and conformity with the Burundi Revenue Authority 30 AFAB members acquire knowledge in coaching and ICT. They are empowered to coach and train other members 20 AFAB members acquire entrepreneurship skills by AFAB trainers trained by SPARK in entrepreneurship skills
Entrepreneurial skills of AFAB members strengthened AFAB members are confident while dealing with partners or government authorities with no fear of corrupt agents. AFAB members leave informal to formal trade
Availability of AFABs website AFAB has its own, regularly updated website 3 staff are trained to manage and update the website AFAB has its own, regularly updated website 3 staff are trained to manage and update the website Number of visits to the website
AFABs staff more skilled on management and accountancy staff are able to keep financial tracks in time Staff provide to SPARK a standardised financial report in professional way. Accountant able to use accounting software to produce financial report 30 AFAB members are familiar with taxation issues and can work in good terms with Burundi Revenue Authority 4 staff members of AFAB are trained and an accounting software is provided
For the objective of poverty alleviation through SME development
AFAB is connected to the outside world, its visibility is ensured and relationship with members , donors and potential partners is improved..The association inform about its activities and projects as well as about its members development. Trough the website AFAB inform about reforms of business laws and news From private sector Conferences, trade fairs, business to business is advertised through the Website

The direct beneficiaries are the women entrepreneurs members of AFAB coming from rural and urban area and the staff of AFAB who will increase their knowledge in specific topics. They will also improve the management of their SMES.
The other indirect beneficiaries are the families of the group mentioned above thank to the good governance and growth of their SMES. The Government wich will see the budget increased in term of taxes and in term of fighting corruption and also in creating some job The foreign partners will take advantage in improving communication of Burundian Women Entrepreneurs.
